content: GF#11451 - @Eric Prud'hommeaux @David Booth - need to work on this
and do we want a connectathon stream or some other alternative to get us to focus on some tangible outcome from the all this RDF work? @Michael van der Zel @Eric Prud'hommeaux @David Booth
It would be excellent to have a RDF stream. We have to come up with a use-case and some servers that implement it (e.g. Spark).
my server implements the turtle format now
what we need is a use case
@David Booth - where are we with GF#11450?

Last week I got the FHIR build working on my laptop, and got the module renamed to Linked Data module, and committed the changes to svn. In order to re-write the page content to focus more on "how to", I need to be able to reference examples of usage, so I need to collect some from people.

@Michael van der Zel , @Eric Prud'hommeaux, @Harold Solbrig and anyone else, I need examples of FHIR RDF usage that I can draw upon for re-writing the Linked Data module pages (formerly called the Ontology module) to have a more "how to" flavor. Can you point me to some, or provide me with some? Who else should I ask?
This is an old example from pre-FHIR days: "...calculated the HEDIS Diabetes quality measure on a population of over 400,000 patients real data" using an OWL ontology.
Thanks, I'll ask Peter Hendler about that.
Here <https://vimeo.com/141875367> is his presentation about it: Use of a RIM-lite OWL triple store to calculate HEDIS quality measures (Peter Hendler, KP)

Thanks @Rob Hausam and @Michael van der Zel . I have written to Peter. It is unclear how much he could have benefited from FHIR RDF. I think it would have simplified translation to the analysis model that he used, which was Entities and Roles Participating in Acts, but I have no data to prove that. I asked if the RIM mapping available in FHIR would have helped, and he didn't think so, because he only used a simple E-R-P-A model, not the full detail of RIM.

right. much of what he did would be extremely straight forward in fhir, because it's just index joins pushed onto the FHIR servers, along with terminology subsumption. But it's still closest use case I've actually seen
